data.name: ModuleHelp.Text
data.value:
There are two types of websites which can be created using this application:

  • Parent Websites are sites which have a unique URL ( ie. www.domain.com ) associated to them. This generally involves purchasing a Domain Name from an Internet Registrar, setting the Primary/Secondary DNS entries to point to the Hosting Provider's DNS Server, and having your Hosting Provider map the Domain Name to the IP Address of your account. An example of a valid Parent Portal Name is www.mydomain.com. You can also use the IP Address of your site without a Domain Name ( ie. 65.174.86.217 ). If you need to have multiple Domain Names pointing to the same portal then you can seperate them with commas ( ie. www.domain1.com,www.domain2.com ). Do not create a Parent Portal until all of the DNS mappings are in place or else you will not be able to access your portal.

  • Child Portals are subhosts of your Hosting Provider account. Essentially this means a directory is created on the web server which allows the site to be accessed through a URL address which includes a Parent domain name as well as the directory name ( ie. www.domain.com/directory ). A Child Portal can be converted into a Parent Portal at any time by simply modifying the Portal Alias entry.

    *Please Note: Portals will be created using the default properties defined in the Host Settings module ( HostFee, HostSpace, DemoPeriod ) or in the selected template file. Once the portal is created, these properties can be modified in the Admin tab Site Settings module.

data.name: plType.Help
data.value: There are two types of sites which can be created using this application (see the Module Help available on the Action Menu for more details).

data.name: DemoMessage.Text
data.value:
Demo Site Signup allows you to create your very own Website and experiment with its advanced features {0}. At any time during or after the trial period, you can convert your Demo Site into a Registered Site by logging in as the Administrator and selecting the Renew/Extend Your Site Subscription link in the Admin tab. Registered Sites have the added benefit of using their own domain name ( ie. www.yourdomain.com ) as their Web address.

*Note: Your Site Name must be a simple name for your site and cannot contain spaces or punctuation characters. The URL for your site will take the form of {1}/sitename

data.name: AdminMissing.Text
data.value: Your admin.template File Is Missing And Must be Uploaded To The Site.

data.name: PortalMissing.Text
data.value: Your site template File Is Missing And Must be Uploaded To The Site.

data.name: plPortalName.Help
data.value: Enter a name for the Site

data.name: plDescription.Help
data.value: Enter a description for your site.

data.name: plKeyWords.Help
data.value: Enter some keywords separated by a comma. These are added to the Html page as MetaData and help Search Engines index your site.

data.name: plTemplate.Help
data.value: Choose a template for the new Site.

data.name: plUsername.Help
data.value: Enter a username for the Administrator Account for this site.

data.name: plPassword.Help
data.value: Enter a password for the Administrator Account for this site.

data.name: plConfirm.Help
data.value: Repeat your password to confirm it was typed correctly.

data.name: plEmail.Help
data.value: Enter an email address for the Administrator Account for this site.

data.name: Note.Text
data.value: *Note: Once your Site is created, you will need to login using the Administrator information specified below.

data.name: InvalidTemplate.Text
data.value: {0} is not a valid Site Template File.

data.name: InvalidName.Text
data.value: The Site Alias Must Not Contain Spaces Or Punctuation.

data.name: InvalidPassword.Text
data.value: The Password Values Entered Do Not Match.

data.name: ChildExists.Text
data.value: The Child Site Name You Specified Already Exists. Please Choose A Different Child Site Name.

data.name: CreateError.Text
data.value: An Error Was Encountered During The Creation Of Your Site. This May Have Been Caused By Specifying An Incorrect Password For An Existing User Account. Please Verify Your Details Before You Try Again.

data.name: plPortalAlias.Help
data.value: Enter the Alias for this Site

data.name: plHomeDirectory.Help
data.value: Enter the Home Directory for this Site

data.name: SendMail.Error
data.value: There was an error sending confirmation emails - {0} However, the website was created. Click Here To Access the new site

data.name: InvalidHomeFolder.Text
data.value: The Home Folder you specified is not valid.

data.name: DuplicatePortalAlias.Text
data.value: The Site Alias Name You Specified Already Exists. Please Choose A Different Site Alias.

data.name: UnknownSendMail.Error
data.value: There was an error sending confirmation emails. However, the website was created. Click Here To Access the new site

data.name: UnknownEmailAddress.Error
data.value: There is no email address set on Site and/or Host level.

data.name: plAnswer.Help
data.value: Enter the answer to the above question.

data.name: plQuestion.Help
data.value: Enter a question to use when requesting a password.

data.name: useCurrentLabel.Help
data.value: Check this box if you want to use the current SuperUser as the Administrator for the site. If this box is unchecked you will be able to enter user credentials for the Administrator.

data.name: DuplicateWithTab.Text
data.value: There is already a page with the same name as you entered for the site alias for this site. Please change the site alias and try again.

data.name: DisallowedExtension.Warning
data.value: The template contains the following extensions that are not normally authorized – {0}. As they are an integral part of the template they have been copied to your site. For more information please check the Event Viewer.

data.name: plSiteGroups.Help
data.value: You can optionally add your new site to an existing site group
